page.title: 07TRANSPORT AND COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: The main means of{transport}for those living in Croston is by car.{Public {transport}is adequate although people would prefer more buses to run at night. Preston, Leyland, Chorley and Southport can be reached by bus. The{railway line}runs from Ormskirk to Preston and trains are approx. every hour.The{station}is threatened with closure and a group called Ormskirk to Preston Train Association is trying to keep rural lines, particularly their own,open.They hold fund raising events and take care of the station's appearance themselves. In Croston there is 1{Post Office}and a{Telecom}building.Collections are Mon -Fri 10.15am and 5.00pm and on Sat at 11.30am.The post is delivered 9.30am and 2.0pm. There are 3 post boxes. 75% of people have a{telephone}in their own homes. There are 3 call boxes.
